column4: /rant dammit why are do many websites still not offer a .deb download
even if they did, that'd guarantee nothing. you need *Ubuntu* packages (and for the right version of Ubuntu)  -  other packages, even if they're .deb, might break your system, or at least not work
ok didn't  know that but still isn't ubuntu bigger then red hat now? But vmware does offer rpm's
that means its page is being visited often
